sources.title: Treasure of Monte Cristo (1949) Crime, Drama, Film-Noir | Full Length Movie
sources.description:
A fast-moving... suspenseful jewel mystery... set against the colorful background of today's San Francisco! 
Edmund Dantes (Langan) works on a ship that docks in San Francisco, & is a descendant of the Count of Monte Cristo. Crooked Lawyer Earl Jackson (Brodie) sets up a scheme to get at the treasure of Monte Cristo, and using the beautiful blonde Jean Turner (Jergens), tries to lure him into a trap.

Director: William Berke
Writers: Aubrey Wisberg, Jack Pollexfen, 
Stars: Glenn Langan, Adele Jergens, Steve Brodie
Genres: Crime, Drama, Film-Noir, Thriller

CCC CHAPTERS: in the general comments tell us your favorite scene and we will add it

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: This modern tale borrows from an old story in establishing Langan, who works on a ship that docks in San Francisco, as a descendant of the Count of Monte Cristo. Crooked Lawyer Brodie sets up a scheme to get at the treasure of Langan's famed ancestor, and using the beautiful blonde Jergens, tries to lure Langan into a trap. Langan proves worthy of his heritage, using a gun instead of a sword, and wins legitimately both his forturne and Jergens.
metadata.Actors: Glenn Langan, Adele Jergens, Steve Brodie
